meanings.definition: To cause to lose balance or stability.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind unbalancing the tall tree.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected push unbalancing the stack of books.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoys unbalancing the vase on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden confession unbalancing his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake violently unbalancing everything in the room.

meanings.definition: To upset the equilibrium or balance of.
meanings.sent1: Adding too much weight unbalancing the seesaw.
meanings.sent2: The new construction unbalancing the ecosystem of the pond.
meanings.sent3: The prankster loves unbalancing the scales at the market.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news unbalancing her carefully laid plans.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the new manager unbalancing the office dynamics.
